required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Synergistic Effect of Paired Associative Stimulation and Vagus Nerve Stimulation on Motor-evoked Potential Potentiation in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: Vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) and paired associative stimulation (PAS) have been shown to have efficacy in improving the results of motor rehabilitation after stroke and spinal cord injury, respectively. Here we will investigate in healthy subjects the synergistic effect of these stimulation modalities on motor-evoked potential (MEP) potentiation.

primary_outcome.description: MEPs are responses to transcranial magnetic stimulation recorded from target muscles.
MEPs are responses to transcranial magnetic stimulation recorded from target muscles.
MEPs are responses to transcranial magnetic stimulation recorded from target muscles.
MEPs are responses to transcranial magnetic stimulation recorded from target muscles.

intervention.description: Paired associative stimulation is a combination of non-invasive transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) and non-invasive peripheral nerve stimulation (PNS)
Non-invasive vagus nerve stimulation delivered through cymba concha & cymba cavum of the ear.

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindications to TMS (e.g. brain pathology, implanted devices)
- contraindications to MRI (e.g. MRI incompatible implants)
- continuous use of CNS-active drugs
- neurological, psychiatric or cardiovascular disease
- drug abuse

reference.citation: Shulga A, Lioumis P, Kirveskari E, Savolainen S, Mäkelä JP. A novel paired associative stimulation protocol with a high-frequency peripheral component: A review on results in spinal cord injury rehabilitation. Eur J Neurosci. 2021 May;53(9):3242-3257. doi: 10.1111/ejn.15191. Epub 2021 Mar 29. Review.

Dawson J, Pierce D, Dixit A, Kimberley TJ, Robertson M, Tarver B, Hilmi O, McLean J, Forbes K, Kilgard MP, Rennaker RL, Cramer SC, Walters M, Engineer N. Safety, Feasibility, and Efficacy of Vagus Nerve Stimulation Paired With Upper-Limb Rehabilitation After Ischemic Stroke. Stroke. 2016 Jan;47(1):143-50. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.115.010477. Epub 2015 Dec 8.
